text: Meiron Amir Cheruti (; born 19 October 1997) is an Israeli swimmer.Swimrankings - Israel Long Course (50m) Rankings"Meiron Cheruti (מירון חירותי)" He competes in 100 m freestyle, 50 m butterfly, 50 m freestyle, 4x100 m freestyle, and 4x50 m freestyle. He will represent Israel at the 2020 Summer Olympics. ==Swimming career== Cheruti started swimming at the age of five, and his club is Maccabi Haifa. He competes in 100 m freestyle, 50 m butterfly, 50 m freestyle, 4x100 m freestyle, and 4x50 m freestyle."Swimming - Meiron Amir Cheruti" He is a member of Project Rising Star, a program that coach David Marsh created with the Israel Swimming Association.Project Rising Star — Team Elite Aquatics ===2018-present=== In December 2018, at the 2018 Arena Israeli Swimming Championships, he won and set Israeli short course national records in the 50 m freestyle (21.27) and the 100 m freestyle (47.41)."FRANKEL, CHERUTI DOWN NATIONAL RECORDS AT ISRAELI CHAMPIONSHIPS" In April 2019, at the Israel Cup, he won the 50 m freestyle."KENDYL STEWART SWIMS LIFETIME BEST IN 100 FLY ON ISRAEL CUP DAY 2" That same month at the Stockholm Open Cheruti won a silver medal in the 50 m freestyle."HOSSZU ROCKS HER FASTEST 200 FLY TIME OF THE SEASON IN STOCKHOLM, SJOSTROM 52.76 1FREE" In June 2019 at the Sette Colli Trophy he set a new Israeli national record in the 50 m butterfly, at 23.65."2019 SETTE COLLI TROPHY: DAY 3 FINALS LIVE RECAP" In July 2019 he competed in the men's 50 m butterfly at the 2019 World Aquatics Championships in Gwangju, South Korea. ==See also== *List of Israeli records in swimming ==References== ==External links== *Meiron Cheruti page, isrswimming.com Category:1997 births Category:Living people Category:Israeli male swimmers Category:Place of birth missing (living people) Category:Swimmers at the 2015 European Games Category:European Games competitors for Israel Category:Male freestyle swimmers Category:Male butterfly swimmers
title: Meiron Cheruti
